background: The Farm Planning model aims to optimize the planning of crops and resources on a farm in order to maximize earnings. The model takes into account various factors such as crop yield, crop price, land availability, labor requirements, water availability, and costs associated with labor and water. The objective is to determine the optimal amount of each crop to plant in order to maximize farm earnings.
description: The Farm Planning model aims to optimize the planning of crops and resources on a farm in order to maximize earnings. The model takes into account various factors such as crop yield, crop price, land availability, labor requirements, water availability, and costs associated with labor and water. The objective is to determine the optimal amount of each crop to plant in order to maximize farm earnings.

parameters.definition: The number of crops available for planting
The number of months in a year
Crop `c` yield in tons per hectare
Crop `c` price in dollars per ton
Amount of crop `c` in consumption bundle `b` in tons
Total land available for planting in hectares
Binary parameter indicating whether a crop is planted or not
Fraction of land occupied by crop `c` in month `t`
Labor required per hectare for each crop in each month
Annual wage rate for family labor in dollars per man
Annual wage rate for permanent labor in dollars per man
Hourly wage rate for temporary labor in dollars per hour
Number of working hours available per month per man
Annual amount of water available in cubic kilometers
Maximum amount of water available per month in cubic kilometers
Water requirement per hectare for each crop in each month in cubic kilometers
Price of water in dollars per cubic kilometer
